alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Sagadahoc; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Sagadahoc. In southwest Maine, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rain is falling over ground that is already saturated from recent rainfall. The runoff is coinciding with high tide which will impede drainage in some communities. Nuisance flooding of low lying roads is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, South Portland, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Alfred, Sanford, Cumberland, Saco and Gorham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
